Package com.stardevllc.stardata.api.interfaces

Interface ObjectCodec<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The Java type that this codec is for
All Known Implementing Classes:
StringSetCodec
public interface ObjectCodec<T>
This is a class to allow parsing of types outside of the default supported types.
To use this class, simply create a class that implements this interface.
Implement the logic for both the encode and decode methods
Then simply annotation your field(s) using the Codec annotation. And that's it for this class
If you would like to have default handling of a Class type, please use the TypeHandler class for that.
Why Strings? Because the default type while using a codec is a VARCHAR on the MySQL Table. This makes it much easier to implement the backend.
An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if you try to use the Type annotation that does not have a VARCHAR value. This is only used for setting the length of the column if you want to have it overriding the default length

    Modifier and Type
    Method

    T
    decode(String encoded)
    Decodes the object from the provided String
    The string passed into this method is the same as the one returned from the encode method
    String
    encode(Object object)
    Encodes an object into a string
    The passed object should be safe to cast.

  • Method Details

    • encode

      String encode(Object object)
      Encodes an object into a string
      The passed object should be safe to cast. It passes in the value in the Field of the Model Class
      Parameters:
      object - The object to encode
      Returns:
      The string form for this object. Please note: This is passed into the decode method

    • decode

      T decode(String encoded)
      Decodes the object from the provided String
      The string passed into this method is the same as the one returned from the encode method
      Parameters:
      encoded - The encoded value
      Returns:
      The decoded object
